stories.original_headline: A century-old Stonehenge mystery may finally be solved
stories.original_summary: Scientists have found compelling new evidence that humans, not glaciers, brought Stonehenge’s bluestones to the site. Using advanced mineral analysis, researchers searched nearby river sediments for signs glaciers once passed through the area—and found none. That missing signature strongly suggests
stories.fantasy_headline: Wizards Uncover Truth of Grand Stone Circle!
stories.fantasy_story: For ages, folk wondered how the giant bluestones reached the Grand Stone Circle. Now, the Whispering Wizards' Guild, using ancient scrying spells, has found no trace of great ice magic moving them. This suggests the stones were moved by ancient builders, not winter spirits, a century-old mystery finally unveiled.

stories.original_headline: Scientists finally explain Earth’s strangest fossils
stories.original_summary: The Ediacara Biota are some of the strangest fossils ever found—soft-bodied organisms preserved in remarkable detail where preservation shouldn’t be possible. Scientists now think their survival in sandstone came from unusual ancient seawater chemistry that created clay “cements” around their bodies
stories.fantasy_headline: Wizards Solve Riddle of Ancient Soft-Bodied Creatures!
stories.fantasy_story: For centuries, the Elder Alchemists pondered the strange stone forms of the Whispering Reef Dwellers, soft creatures preserved perfectly in sandstone. Now, they believe unique ocean enchantments in ancient sea magic allowed magical binding mud to encase them, solving a grand riddle of time.

stories.original_headline: You’ll be able to change the color of Virtual Boy games on Nintendo Switch Online
stories.original_summary: Following the initial reveal last September, Nintendo has released a new trailer detailing which Virtual Boy games will be available to Switch Online subscribers starting on February 17th alongside revamped headsets, and which titles will launch later this year. The company also revealed some new fe
stories.fantasy_headline: Ninten Clan Adds Ancient Vision Games to Realm Gate!
stories.fantasy_story: The venerable Ninten Clan announced new illusory goggle plays are coming to the Realm Gate Network. Soon, folk can invoke color-shifting magic to alter the hue of these ancient Enchanted Vision Scrying Games. These long-awaited additions promise many hours of magical amusement for all.
